headline.main: PEARL HARBOR RAID AS SEEN BY A NUN; Sister Mary Cecile O'Neil Gives Her Impression in Letter to Maryknoll House SCENE UNFORGETTABLE Change From Supposed War Games to Real Thing Mixed Comedy With Tragedy

lead_paragraph: MARYKNOLL, N.Y., Feb. 28 -- On an exposed hilltop during the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor a group of Maryknoll sisters, on an errand of mercy, escaped injury from the bombs and machine-gun bullets that rained about them, according to a letter received by the mother house here from one of the group, Sister Mary Cecile O'Neill, of Forge Village, Mass.
abstract: Jap attack on Pearl Harbor described
